lead_paragraph: WHEELER--Dr. Barbara A.,81, former Professor of Anthropology and Director of Africana Studies at Kean University transitioned peacefully on April 25, 2016, at her residence in Union, NJ. She will be remembered as a pioneering International Pan Africanist who developed the "African Disapora Travelearn" Course at Kean University. Formerly Deputy Director of Black Studies at the City College of New York, and a founding member of African Heritage Studies Association. She is survived by her children, Roni L. and William G. Wheeler, Jr.; one grandson, three great-grandchildren; two sisters and one brother and a host of family and friends spanning the globe. Reflective Viewing Services will be held at Metropolitan Baptist Church, 149 Springfield Ave., Newark, NJ 07103 on Friday, April 29th, 6-8pm and The Celebration of Her Life; Saturday, April 30th at 9am-1pm. Interment will be at Hollywood Memorial Park, 1500 Stuyvesant Ave., Union, NJ. The family requests that in lieu of flowers, donations be made to "Dr. Barbara Wheeler Scholarship Fund" c/o Professor Tobi at Kean Univ. mtoby@kean.edu. Professional services are provided by Islamic Burial Services, Funeral Director, Hawwah Karim 973-484-1494. 1/3
